intro: Vernonia kirkii, commonly known as the African ironweed, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters in height, characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and showy yellow flowers. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its composite flower heads. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its flowers are arranged in clusters at the ends of branches. Vernonia kirkii is also valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional medicine across its native range.
